original_solution_mapping.L1: The bigger sail will make the trip in 4 hours because 200 / 50 = <<200/50=4>>4
original_solution_mapping.L2: The smaller sail will make the trip in 10 hours because 200 / 20 = <<200/20=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L3: The bigger sail will be 6 hours faster because 10 - 4 = <<10-4=6>>6

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3589.
    Returns: the number of hours faster the bigger sail is than the smaller one.
    """
    # L1
    total_distance = 200 # He plans to travel 200 miles
    speed_bigger_sail = 50 # When he uses his 24 square foot sail he goes 50 MPH
    time_bigger_sail = total_distance / speed_bigger_sail

    # L2
    speed_smaller_sail = 20 # When he uses his 12 square foot sail he goes 20 MPH
    time_smaller_sail = total_distance / speed_smaller_sail

    # L3
    time_difference = time_smaller_sail - time_bigger_sail

    # FA
    answer = time_difference
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The bigger sail will make the trip in {time_bigger_sail} hours because {total_distance} / {speed_bigger_sail} = <<{total_distance}/{speed_bigger_sail}={time_bigger_sail}>>{time_bigger_sail}
The smaller sail will make the trip in {time_smaller_sail} hours because {total_distance} / {speed_smaller_sail} = <<{total_distance}/{speed_smaller_sail}={time_smaller_sail}>>{time_smaller_sail}
The bigger sail will be {time_difference} hours faster because {time_smaller_sail} - {time_bigger_sail} = <<{time_smaller_sail}-{time_bigger_sail}={time_difference}>>{time_difference}

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'total_distance' (value: 200) was used instead of 'time_smaller_sail' (value: 10.0).
